DOC.brief_summary: To compare short-term astigmatic outcome phacoemulsification cataract surgery intraocular lens implantation use temporal versus nasal clear corneal incision .
DOC.brief_title: Surgically Induced Astigmatism Temporal Versus Nasal Clear Corneal Phacoemulsification
DOC.detailed_description: In clinical trial , consecutive eye senile cataract underwent phacoemulsification implantation 6.0 mm foldable hydrophobic acrylic intraocular lens 3.2 mm horizontal clear cornea incision 180 degree ( temporal incision right eye , nasal incision leave eye ) . Keratometric astigmatism measure preoperatively one four week 6 month surgery . Surgically induced astigmatism ( SIA ) calculate vector analysis method use Holladay-Cravy-Koch formula . Patients history diabetes mellitus , connective tissue disorder , steroid use , previous ocular surgery , rule astigmatism > 1D , pseudoexfoliation corneal pathology exclude .
DOC.criteria: All patient senile cataract Previously operate eye Presence corneal pathology Pseudo exfoliation Withtherule ( WTR ) astigmatism > 1 D Presence diabetes mellitus History connective tissue disease Consumption systemic steroid
